chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Edwin Wilke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING April 22, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 24.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory Court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA and DV surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at zero.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.
Court advised that under 48USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

No contact with  victim Nicole W.  Court approved text for issues regarding  their child.
No contact with  firearms.

Provide DNA sample.
Batterers Intervention.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eric Edwin Wilke in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties, Nicole W., and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Nicole W. Court approved text for issues regarding their child.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Victim Impact Statement

Probation Review Hearing scheduled on 4/22/2016 at 1:30 pm in branch 24.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED:
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Eric Edwin Wilke in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. Amended Criminal Complaint received and filed. 

AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT READS:
Count 1: Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.0125(2)(a), 939.51(3)(b), and 973.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric Edwin Wilke in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant is going to have surgery around the time of the trial.  Court granted request for adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 24.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Edwin Wilke in court with attorney Eloisa De Leon.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State is ready to proceed.  Court granted defense counsel to adjourn as they have just discovered new witnesses.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Edwin Wilke in court with attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 10/14/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-29-2015 at 01:30 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-14-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Eric Edwin Wilke in court with Attorney Marc Efton Christopher.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requested that case be heard on today's date.
Defense counsel informs Court that he will now be counsel of record and requests adjournment of the jury trial as this is his first appearance as to this case.
Court orders jury trial of 08-31-2015 vacated and case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
Court modified the no contact order to allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Defendant Eric Edwin Wilke in court with attorney Eloisa De Leon.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM029082  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/11/2015
Court ordered the Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nicole W.

Defendant Eric Edwin Wilke in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant states he will retain counsel. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/11/15 @ 1:30pm
